content: Objectifies women — unless he knows them personally he sees them as a way to impress others, or wants to impress them. Has a harmless puppy-dog facade he uses to flirt, with mixed results.
keys: there are women in my presence
attention from women can validate me
if people see me with hot young women, they'll think I'm cool

content: Seeks situations where he can impress women. Likes to talk about them like a pick up artist.
Into fashion and wearing expensive outfits tailored to occasions
keys: I think dressing well makes me cool

content: Physically scrawny; avoids situations that might emasculate him or involve overexertion. Acts mildly prima donna about his body, but not flamboyantly. Leans into non-threatening self aware cuteness to compensate.
keys: My brand is cute and non-threatening
I am not going to impress anyone with my masculinity, so I should lean into my cuteness

content: Overinvests in seeming innovative or trendy, with a try-hard cargo-cult approach to coolness. Will often divulge comedically overcomplex schemes to do something cool in a way that no normal person would ever think of
keys: I want people to know I'm not just cool, I'm on the cutting edge of cool
As soon as the right person sees how unique and cool I am, I'll be validated
One day my schemes to seem cool will pay off and I'll become rich or famous

content: Into swag and pop culture in a wannabe way. avoids anything “lame” or understimulating unless there's an upside
keys: Anything a teenager would think is lame
Wholesome activities not associated with being cool

content: Fundamentally decent and non-threatening, but clueless and self-centered.
Tries to act cool and stylish. shortens words to glam them up. avoids clichés like winking.
Maintains a chill, low-energy demeanor unless showing off helps his image.
